Last update: 17.01.2025

## Terms & Conditions

**Effective Date:** 01/02/2025

### Introduction

Welcome to **Coldbean Inc.** (“us”, “we”, or “our”), which operates [https://coldbean.ai](https://coldbean.ai/) and any associated subdomains (hereinafter referred to as “Service”). This Privacy Policy governs your visit to [https://coldbean.ai](https://coldbean.ai/) and explains how we collect, safeguard, and disclose information resulting from your use of our Service.

We use your data to provide and improve our Service. By using the Service, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy. Unless otherwise defined in this Privacy Policy, terms used herein have the same meanings as in our Terms and Conditions. Our Terms and Conditions (“Terms”) govern all use of our Service, and together with this Privacy Policy constitute your agreement with us (“agreement”).

## Definitions

1. **SERVICE**

Refers to the [https://coldbean.ai](https://coldbean.ai/) website (and any associated subdomains) operated by Coldbean Inc.

2. **PERSONAL DATA**

Means data about a living individual who can be identified from those data (or from those and other information either in our possession or likely to come into our possession).

3. **USAGE DATA**

Data collected automatically, generated either by the use of the Service or from the Service infrastructure itself (for example, the duration of a page visit).

4. **COOKIES**

Small files stored on your device (computer or mobile device).

5. **DATA CONTROLLER**

A natural or legal person who (either alone or jointly or in common with other persons) determines the purposes for which and the manner in which personal data are, or are to be, processed. For the purpose of this Privacy Policy, Coldbean Inc. is the Data Controller of your data.

6. **DATA PROCESSORS (OR SERVICE PROVIDERS)**

Any natural or legal person who processes the data on behalf of the Data Controller. We may use various Service Providers to process your data more effectively.

7. **DATA SUBJECT**

Any living individual who is the subject of Personal Data.

8. **THE USER**

The individual using our Service. The User corresponds to the Data Subject, who is the subject of Personal Data.


## Information Collection and Use

We collect several different types of information for various purposes to provide and improve our Service for you.

## Types of Data Collected

### 1\. Personal Data

While using our Service, we may ask you to provide certain personally identifiable information (“Personal Data”) that can be used to contact or identify you. Personally identifiable information may include, but is not limited to:

- (a) Email address

- (b) First name and last name

- (c) Phone number

- (d) Cookies and Usage Data


We may use your Personal Data to contact you with newsletters, marketing or promotional materials, and other information that may be of interest to you. You may opt out of receiving any or all of these communications from us by following the unsubscribe link provided in our emails or by contacting us at **support@coldbean.ai**.

### 2\. Usage Data

We may also collect information that your browser sends whenever you visit our Service or when you access the Service by or through a mobile device (“Usage Data”). This Usage Data may include information such as:

- Your computer’s Internet Protocol (IP) address

- Browser type, browser version

- The pages of our Service you visit

- The time and date of your visit

- The time spent on those pages

- Unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data


When you access the Service with a mobile device, this Usage Data may include:

- The type of mobile device you use

- Your mobile device’s unique ID

- The IP address of your mobile device

- Your mobile operating system and mobile Internet browser type

- Unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data


### 3\. Tracking Cookies Data

We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to track the activity on our Service, and we hold certain information. Cookies are files with a small amount of data which may include an anonymous unique identifier. Cookies are sent to your browser from a website and stored on your device. Other tracking technologies such as beacons, tags, and scripts are also used to collect and track information and to improve and analyze our Service.

You can instruct your browser to refuse all cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent. However, if you do not accept cookies, some portions of our Service may not function properly.

**Examples of Cookies we use**:

- **Session Cookies**: To operate our Service.

- **Preference Cookies**: To remember your preferences and various settings.

- **Security Cookies**: For security purposes.

- **Advertising Cookies**: Used to serve advertisements relevant to your interests.


### 4\. Other Data

While using our Service, we may also collect the following information (if you choose to provide it): sex, age, date of birth, place of birth, passport details, citizenship, registration at place of residence and actual address, telephone number (work, mobile), details of education, qualifications, professional training, employment agreements, non-disclosure agreements, information on bonuses and compensation, marital status, family members, social security or taxpayer identification number, office location, and other data.

## Use of Data

Coldbean Inc. uses the collected data for various purposes, including but not limited to:

01. To provide and maintain our Service.

02. To notify you about changes to our Service.

03. To allow you to participate in interactive features of our Service when you choose to do so.

04. To provide customer support.

05. To gather analysis or valuable information so we can improve our Service.

06. To monitor the usage of our Service.

07. To detect, prevent, and address technical issues.

08. To fulfill any other purpose for which you provide it.

09. To carry out our obligations and enforce our rights arising from any contracts entered into between you and us, including for billing and collection.

10. To provide you with notices about your account and/or subscription, including expiration and renewal notices, email instructions, etc.

11. To provide you with news, special offers, and general information about other goods, services, and events we offer that are similar to those that you have already purchased or enquired about, unless you have opted not to receive such information.

12. In any other way we may describe when you provide the information.

13. For any other purpose with your consent.


## Retention of Data

We will retain your Personal Data only as long as necessary for the purposes set out in this Privacy Policy. We will retain and use your Personal Data to the extent necessary to:

- Comply with our legal obligations (e.g., if we are required to retain data to comply with applicable laws).

- Resolve disputes.

- Enforce our legal agreements and policies.


We also retain Usage Data for internal analysis purposes. Usage Data is generally retained for a shorter period, except where it is used to strengthen the security or functionality of our Service, or where we are legally obligated to retain this data for extended periods.

## Transfer of Data

Your information, including Personal Data, may be transferred to — and maintained on — computers located outside your state, province, country, or other governmental jurisdiction, where data protection laws may differ from those in your jurisdiction.

If you are located outside the United States and choose to provide information to us, please note that we transfer the data, including Personal Data, to the United States and process it there. Your consent to this Privacy Policy followed by your submission of such information represents your agreement to that transfer.

Coldbean Inc. will take all steps reasonably necessary to ensure that your data is treated securely and in accordance with this Privacy Policy. No transfer of your Personal Data will take place to an organization or a country unless there are adequate controls in place (including the security of your data and other personal information).

## Disclosure of Data

We may disclose personal information we collect, or you provide, in the following situations:

1. **Disclosure for Law Enforcement**

Under certain circumstances, we may be required to disclose your Personal Data if required to do so by law or in response to valid requests by public authorities.

2. **Business Transaction**

If we or our subsidiaries are involved in a merger, acquisition, or asset sale, your Personal Data may be transferred.

3. **Other Cases**

We may disclose your information also:

   - (i) To our subsidiaries and affiliates.

   - (ii) To contractors, service providers, and other third parties we use to support our business.

   - (iii) To fulfill the purpose for which you provide it.

   - (iv) For the purpose of including your company’s logo on our website (with your permission).

   - (v) For any other purpose disclosed by us when you provide the information.

   - (vi) With your consent in any other cases.

   - (vii) If we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to protect the rights, property, or safety of the Company, our customers, or others.

## Security of Data

The security of your data is important to us, but remember that no method of transmission over the internet or method of electronic storage is 100% secure. While we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your Personal Data, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

## Your Data Protection Rights Under General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)

If you are a resident of the European Union (EU) or the European Economic Area (EEA), you have certain data protection rights covered by GDPR. You may contact us at **support@coldbean.ai** to:

- Access, update, or delete the information we hold about you.

- Correct or rectify inaccurate or incomplete personal information.

- Object to our processing of your Personal Data.

- Request the restriction of processing of your personal information.

- Request a copy of your Personal Data in a structured, machine-readable, and commonly used format.

- Withdraw your consent at any time where we relied on your consent to process your personal information.


Please note that we may ask you to verify your identity before responding to such requests. Some data may be required for the Service to function properly; removal of that data may affect your ability to use certain features of the Service.

If you have a concern about our collection and use of your Personal Data, you have the right to complain to a data protection authority. For more information, please contact your local data protection authority within the EEA.

## Your Data Protection Rights under the California Online Privacy Protection Act (CalOPPA)

CalOPPA requires commercial websites and online services to post a privacy policy. According to CalOPPA, we agree to the following:

- Users can visit our site anonymously.

- Our Privacy Policy link includes the word “Privacy,” and can easily be found on our website.

- Users will be notified of any privacy policy changes on this Privacy Policy page.

- Users can change their personal information by emailing us at **support@coldbean.ai**.


**Our Policy on “Do Not Track” Signals:**

We honor Do Not Track signals and do not track, plant cookies, or use advertising when a Do Not Track browser mechanism is in place. You can enable or disable Do Not Track by visiting the preferences or settings page of your web browser.

## Your Data Protection Rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA)

If you are a California resident, you are entitled to learn about what data we collect about you, ask to delete your data, and not to sell or share it. You may exercise your data protection rights by contacting us at **support@coldbean.ai**. Specifically, you can request:

1. **Disclosure of Personal Information We Collect and Share**

   - The categories of personal information we have collected.

   - The categories of sources from which we collect personal information.

   - The business or commercial purpose for collecting personal information.

   - The categories of third parties with whom we share personal information.

   - The specific pieces of personal information we have collected about you.

   - The categories of personal information that we sold or disclosed for a business purpose.
2. **Deletion of Your Personal Information**

We will delete the personal information we hold about you (subject to certain legal exceptions).

3. **Opt-Out of the Sale of Personal Information**

We do not sell personal information for monetary consideration. If, under the CCPA’s broader definition of “sell,” a transfer of personal information is considered a “sale,” you have the right to request that we stop such transfers.


We will not discriminate against you for exercising any of your CCPA rights. For additional information or to exercise your California data protection rights, please contact us at **support@coldbean.ai**.

## Service Providers

We may employ third-party companies and individuals to facilitate our Service (“Service Providers”), provide the Service on our behalf, perform Service-related tasks, or assist us in analyzing how our Service is used. These third parties have access to your Personal Data only to perform these tasks on our behalf and are obligated not to disclose or use it for any other purpose.

## Analytics

We may use third-party Service Providers to monitor and analyze the use of our Service.

### Google Analytics

Provided by Google, it tracks and reports website traffic. Google uses the collected data to contextualize and personalize ads on its own advertising network. To learn more, visit [Google Privacy & Terms](https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en).

### Cloudflare Analytics

Provided by Cloudflare Inc. For more information, see [Cloudflare Privacy Policy](https://www.cloudflare.com/privacypolicy/).

### Large Language Models

We may use third-party Service Providers who offer API access to Large Language Models (LLMs) for certain functionalities in our Service.

#### OpenAI

For more information about OpenAI’s privacy practices, please visit [OpenAI Privacy Policy](https://openai.com/policies/privacy-policy).

#### Claude by Anthropic

For Anthropic’s privacy practices, visit [Anthropic Privacy Policy](https://console.anthropic.com/legal/privacy).

#### Bard by Google

A conversational AI chatbot developed by Google. For details on Google’s privacy policies, see [Google Privacy Policy](https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en).

## CI/CD Tools

We may use third-party Service Providers to automate the development process of our Service.

### GitHub

Provided by GitHub, Inc. For more information, see [GitHub Privacy Policy](https://help.github.com/en/articles/github-privacy-statement).

### GitLab CI/CD

Provided by GitLab, Inc. For more information, see [GitLab Privacy Policy](https://about.gitlab.com/privacy/).

## Behavioral Remarketing

Coldbean Inc. uses remarketing services to advertise on third-party websites after you visited our Service. We and our third-party vendors use cookies to inform, optimize, and serve ads based on your past visits to our Service.

### Google Ads (AdWords)

Provided by Google Inc. For more information, see [Google Privacy Policy](https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en).

### Bing Ads Remarketing

Provided by Microsoft Inc. For more information, see [Microsoft Privacy Statement](https://privacy.microsoft.com/).

### Twitter

Provided by Twitter Inc. For more information, see [Twitter Privacy Policy](https://twitter.com/privacy).

### Facebook

Provided by Facebook Inc. For more information, see [Facebook Data Policy](https://www.facebook.com/privacy/explanation).

## Payments

We may provide paid products and/or services within the Service and use third-party payment processors (e.g., Stripe). We do not store or collect your payment card details. That information is provided directly to our third-party payment processors, whose use of your personal information is governed by their Privacy Policy.

### Stripe

For details, visit [Stripe Privacy Policy](https://stripe.com/us/privacy).

## Links to Other Sites

Our Service may contain links to other sites not operated by us. If you click on a third-party link, you will be directed to that third party’s site. We strongly advise you to review the Privacy Policy of every site you visit. We have no control over and assume no responsibility for the content, privacy policies, or practices of any third-party sites or services.

## Children’s Privacy

Our Service is not intended for use by children under the age of 18 (“Child” or “Children”). We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from anyone under 18. If you become aware that a Child has provided us with Personal Data, please contact us at **support@coldbean.ai**. If we become aware that we have collected Personal Data from Children without verification of parental consent, we will take steps to remove that information from our servers.

## Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page and updating the “Effective Date” at the top. We may also let you know via email and/or a prominent notice on our Service prior to the changes becoming effective. We encourage you to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any updates. Changes are effective when posted on this page.

## Contact Us

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us:

- By email: **support@coldbean.ai**

- By mail:

**Coldbean Inc.**

**126 Coopers Hawk Dr**

**Mechanicsburg, PA 17050**

**United States**

## Terms & Conditions

GENERAL INFORMATION

Introduction

These Terms of Service (“Terms,” “Terms of Service”) govern your use of our website(s) located at [**https://coldbean.ai**](https://coldbean.ai/) (and any associated subdomains) operated by **Coldbean Inc.** (“Company,” “Service,” “we,” “our,” “us”). These Terms constitute a legally binding agreement between you (“you,” “User,” “customer”) and Coldbean Inc.

Our [Privacy Policy](https://coldbean.ai/privacy) explains how we collect, safeguard, and disclose information resulting from your use of our web pages and associated services. Please read both these Terms and our Privacy Policy carefully (collectively, the “Agreements”). By accessing or using our Service, you acknowledge that you have read and understood the Agreements, and agree to be bound by them.

If you do not agree with the Agreements, you must not (and do not have our permission to) use the Service.

These Terms apply to all visitors, users, and others who wish to access or use the Service.

We may modify these Terms, in whole or in part, at our sole discretion. We will post any updated version of these Terms on [**https://coldbean.ai**](https://coldbean.ai/) or provide you notice by another reasonable method. Any changes will be effective immediately upon posting or our notifying you, unless otherwise indicated.

Communications

By creating an account on our Service, you agree to subscribe to newsletters, marketing or promotional materials, and other information we may send. You may opt out of receiving any or all communications from us by following the unsubscribe link in our emails or by emailing **support@coldbean.ai**.

PROHIBITED AND UNAUTHORIZED USE

You agree not to use the Service in any manner that violates our Acceptable Use policies or these Terms, or for any unlawful or prohibited purpose. Specifically, you will **not**:

1. Directly or indirectly reverse engineer, decompile, disassemble, or otherwise attempt to uncover or discover the source code or underlying structure of the Service, any software, documentation, or data related to the Service.

2. Modify, translate, or create derivative works based on the Service (except to the extent expressly permitted by us).

3. Remove any proprietary notices or labels from our materials.

4. Use the Service if prohibited by law in your jurisdiction.

5. Use the Service if your communications or data are subject to laws such as HIPAA, FISMA, or any other regulation for which our Service is not designed.


**No Sensitive Information**

The Service is **not** designed to process Sensitive Information. You agree not to use the Service to collect or process any information that requires special handling under applicable laws (e.g., health data, financial data, or similarly protected information). We disclaim any liability that may result if you use the Service to process Sensitive Information.

Customer Responsibilities

To fully benefit from the Service, you may need to provide certain resources and efforts on your end (e.g., a project manager, technical resource, etc.). You are responsible for creating sales personas, setting up and monitoring email campaigns, warming up and adding mailboxes, verifying contact details, and integrating our Service with other sales/marketing systems as needed.

FEES AND SUBSCRIPTION

Free Trial

Coldbean Inc. may offer a free trial period (“Free Trial”) at our sole discretion. We may require billing information to begin a Free Trial. If you do not cancel before the Free Trial ends, you may be charged the applicable subscription fees at the start of the billing cycle following the Free Trial. We reserve the right to modify or cancel the Free Trial at any time without notice.

Purchases

When you purchase products or services (“Purchase”) through our Service, you may be required to supply certain information (e.g., credit card number, billing address). Payments may be processed by third-party providers (e.g., Stripe, PayPal). You assume all risk arising from your use of these third-party services.

You represent that (i) you have the legal right to use any payment method provided, and (ii) the information you supply is true and correct. We may refuse or cancel your order if fraud or unauthorized or illegal transactions are suspected.

Fees and Subscription

Our Service may be provided on a subscription basis (“Subscription”). You will be billed in advance on a recurring and periodic basis (“Billing Cycle”), which may be monthly or annually, depending on your plan.

The subscription fee is fixed during the initial term unless you exceed usage limits, upgrade products, subscribe to additional features, or otherwise agree to fee changes. We may also adjust fees downward at our discretion.

At the end of each Billing Cycle, your Subscription will automatically renew under the same conditions unless you cancel it or we cancel it (see “Notice of Non-Renewal”). A valid payment method is required for recurring billing. If automatic billing fails, you must promptly pay all amounts due.

All fees are exclusive of taxes. You are responsible for paying taxes applicable to your use of the Subscription.

Fee Changes

We may modify Subscription fees at our sole discretion. Any fee change will be effective at the end of your then-current Billing Cycle. We will provide you with reasonable notice of any changes. Your continued use of the Service after the effective date constitutes your agreement to the changed fees.

TERM AND RENEWAL

Term and Renewal

Your initial subscription term is specified in your order form or subscription agreement (“Order”). Unless otherwise stated, your subscription automatically renews for successive periods equal to the initial term (or one year, whichever is shorter).

Notice of Non-Renewal

To prevent renewal, you must give written notice of non-renewal at least **10 days prior** to the end of your current term. You may do this by emailing **support@coldbean.ai** or adjusting your auto-renew settings in your Coldbean account.

Early Cancellation

You may cancel your subscription early; however, **no refunds** will be provided for prepaid fees or unused Subscription periods. You must pay all unpaid fees through the end of your subscription term.

Termination for Cause

Either party may terminate for cause if the other party materially breaches this Agreement and fails to cure the breach within **30 days** of receiving notice. We may also terminate immediately if you become bankrupt or insolvent, or if we determine you have acted in a manner harmful to us or our users.

Refunds

Except where required by law, **Subscription fees are non-refundable**.

SUSPENSION

Suspension for Prohibited Acts

We may suspend your access to the Service without notice if:

1. You use the Service in violation of any law or these Terms.

2. Your use of the Service results in excessive bounces, spam complaints, or repeated copyright/trademark infringement notices.


Suspension for Non-Payment

If you fail to pay amounts due, we may suspend your access after providing notice and giving you a grace period. If you dispute charges in good faith and cooperate to resolve the dispute, we will not suspend your account during that process.

Suspension for Present Harm

If your use of the Service (e.g., website denial of service attacks, security vulnerabilities, excessive bandwidth consumption) threatens our operations or other customers, we may suspend your access. We will attempt to limit the suspension to the problematic use only and promptly resolve the issues.

Effect of Termination or Expiration

Upon termination or expiration, you must stop using the Service. If you terminate for cause, we will refund any prepaid but unused fees. If we terminate for cause, you must pay all fees through the end of the term. Fees are otherwise non-refundable.

CUSTOMER DATA

Customer’s Proprietary Rights

You retain all rights to any information you submit to the Service (“Customer Data”). We do not own your Customer Data. You grant us the right to use your Customer Data to provide the Service and as permitted by these Terms. You represent that you have all necessary rights to use the Service on behalf of any entity you represent.

Data Practices and Machine Learning

We may collect data about how you and your users interact with our Service. We may use Customer Data for machine learning to enhance and develop the Service. You may opt out by contacting **support@coldbean.ai**.

ACCEPTABLE USE

Prohibited Email Actions

You may not use our Service to send spam or unsolicited messages in violation of CAN-SPAM or other applicable laws. Emails must not contain false or misleading information. Lists used for email campaigns must not be obtained through scrapers or other unauthorized methods.

Telephone, SMS, and Message Marketing

You must comply with all telemarketing and privacy laws, including TCPA in the U.S. You also must comply with carrier compliance obligations for SMS and telephony.

No Disruption

You agree not to:

- Attack, disrupt, or interfere with the Service or another’s property.

- Launch any automated system that sends more requests to our servers than humanly feasible.

- Attempt unauthorized access to the Service or user accounts.

- Share unique login credentials among multiple users.

- Use the Service to harm or endanger others’ operations or to cause blacklisting of Coldbean’s IP addresses or domains.


Proper Usage of the Service

You will adhere to any Service Limits or usage policies we publish. You will **not** use the Service to share content that is threatening, hateful, defamatory, invasive of privacy, fraudulent, infringing on intellectual property, or otherwise illegal under applicable laws. We reserve the right to terminate accounts engaged in prohibited activities.

Restricted Industries

We reserve the right to prohibit or discontinue use of the Service if you operate in certain high-risk industries (e.g., cryptocurrency, gambling, multi-level marketing) that may generate high abuse complaints.

ANALYTICS AND LLM USAGE

Analytics

We may employ third-party analytics providers (e.g., Google Analytics, Cloudflare) to monitor traffic and usage.

Large Language Models

We may use third-party LLM providers (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic, Bard by Google) to provide portions of our Service. These providers may handle data according to their own Privacy Policies and Terms of Use, which you should review.

NO USE BY MINORS

You must be at least **18 years old** to use this Service. By creating an account, you represent and warrant that you meet this age requirement.

Accounts

When creating an account, you must provide accurate, complete, and current information. You are responsible for safeguarding your account credentials. You must notify us immediately of any unauthorized account use.

We reserve the right to refuse service, terminate accounts, remove or edit content, or cancel orders at our sole discretion.

INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY AND CONFIDENTIALITY

Intellectual Property

This Agreement grants you **no** license to our software. Coldbean Inc. retains all intellectual property rights in the Service and any related materials. You agree not to copy, rent, sell, or create derivative works of our materials without prior written consent.

You may post or share content via the Service (“Content”). You must ensure that you own or have the rights to post such Content. We are not liable for user-generated Content. By posting Content, you grant us the right to use, perform, display, reproduce, and distribute it as necessary to operate the Service.

Confidentiality

Both parties agree to keep each other’s confidential information secret. Confidential information does not include information that is public, lawfully received from a third party, independently developed, or previously known without confidentiality obligations.

If compelled by law to disclose confidential information, we will notify the disclosing party if possible. Upon request, each party will return or destroy the other’s confidential information at the end of this Agreement.

COPYRIGHT POLICY

We respect the intellectual property rights of others. If you believe your copyrighted material is used on the Service in a way that constitutes infringement, please notify us at **copyright@coldbean.ai**.

Your notice must comply with the requirements of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA).

ERROR REPORTING AND FEEDBACK

You may provide feedback, suggestions, or ideas to **support@coldbean.ai**. You agree that all feedback is non-confidential and we may use it without obligation or compensation to you.

LIABILITY

Our Service may contain links to third-party websites. We do not control or endorse these websites and are not responsible for their content or practices. Your use of such links is at your own risk.

Disclaimer of Warranty

Our Service is provided **“AS IS”** and **“AS AVAILABLE”** without warranties of any kind. We disclaim any implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and non-infringement. We do not warrant uninterrupted or error-free service.

Limitation of Liability

To the fullest extent permitted by law, Coldbean Inc. and its officers, directors, employees, and agents are not liable for any indirect, punitive, special, incidental, or consequential damages related to your use of the Service, even if we have been advised of the possibility of such damages. Our maximum liability is limited to the amount you paid for the Service in the twelve (12) months preceding the claim.

Indemnification

You agree to indemnify and hold us harmless from any third-party claims arising from:

We will promptly notify you of such claims and cooperate with you. You will not settle any claim imposing an obligation on us without our prior written consent.

GOVERNING LAW AND ARBITRATION

Governing Law

Arbitration, Class Action Waiver, and Applicable Law

3. **Class Action Waiver**. Claims must be brought **individually**, not as a plaintiff or class member in any class or representative action.

5. **Location and Jurisdiction**. For residents outside the United States, arbitration shall be initiated in **San Francisco County, California**. For non-arbitrable claims, you consent to the jurisdiction of state or federal courts in **San Francisco County, California**.


MISCELLANEOUS

## Fair Use Policy

This Fair Use Policy regulates your use of the Service.

This Fair Use Policy is subject to and should be read in conjunction with the Terms available at Terms of Use (coldbean.ai). Any reference to “we,” “us” or “our” in this Fair Use Policy means Coldbean and its related entities or bodies corporate. Any reference to “you" means the Users of the Service. All capitalised terms used in this Fair Use Policy that are not defined herein have the meanings given to them in the Terms.

Purpose of this Fair Use Policy

The purpose of this Fair Use Policy is to ensure that all the Users have fair and equal access to the Service, while preventing abuse or misuse of the Service, even by those Users who have subscribed to an unlimited plan of the Service. This Fair Use Policy along with the Terms establishes the terms and conditions that govern your use of the Service and any other related Agreement or legal relationship with us.

Applicability of this Fair Use Policy

This Fair Use Policy applies to all use of the Service by you, including if you have subscribed for an unlimited plan. Your use of the Service constitutes your acceptance of this Fair Use Policy. Further, this Fair Use Policy constitutes a part of the Terms, and you are deemed to accept the Fair Use Policy by virtue of accepting the Terms.

Changes to this Fair Use Policy

We reserve the right to amend or otherwise modify the Fair Use Policy at any time. In such cases, we will appropriately inform you of these changes. Such changes will only affect the relationship with the Users for the future. The continued use of the Service will signify your acceptance of the revised Fair Use Policy. If you do not wish to be bound by the changes, you must stop using the Service.

Fair Use of the Service

You must make fair and reasonable use of the Service, even if you have subscribed for an unlimited plan. In general, legitimate use of the Service for its intended purpose will not cause you to be in breach of this Fair Use Policy. We retain the exclusive right to determine the activities of the Users that may be deemed unreasonable use of the Service. Unreasonable use of the Service includes, without limitation, any use:

- which is in breach of any applicable law, including without limitation any law or regulation in relation to privacy, data or spam;

- which interferes with others’ use, access or enjoyment of the Service;

- which causes significant congestion or reduces our ability to fairly and equitably provide the Service to other Users;

- which attempts to bypass or manipulate limitations or usage restrictions on the Service;

- which is not genuinely needed by the User for their legitimate business needs;

- which constitutes abnormal or excessive use of the Service compared to the average use by other users on similar plans;

- which results in restricted or disallowed content being disseminated through the Service, including, without limitation, spam; or

- which involves resupplying or reselling the Service or sharing access the Service without our express written consent.


For the purposes of this Fair Use Policy, examples of abnormal or excessive use of the Service includes, without limitation, establishment of mailboxes by you in a manner which contravenes, undermines or subverts the reasonable and acceptable use of the Service or the subscription plan chosen by you, such as for spamming email recipients, or abusing the unlimited email warm-up offered by us.

The following will constitute provisional thresholds for mailboxes, anything in excess of which will require manual approval by us (which we may refuse at our sole discretion:

which is in breach of any applicable law, including without limitation any law or regulation in relation to privacy, data or spam;

- Basic plan - 100 mailboxes;

- Popular plan – 300 mailboxes and

- Pro plan - 800 mailboxes.


Monitoring Compliance with Fair Use Policy

We are under no obligation to monitor your compliance with this Fair Use Policy. However, we may from time to time take steps to detect and prevent unreasonable use of the Service or use otherwise in breach of this Fair Use Policy. By way of an example, we may apply usage control limits to certain features of the Service to prevent unusual or excessive use of the Service. If you believe the Service has been misused by a third party, has been barred as a result of an accident or error, or wish to request that usage limit controls placed on your use of the Service be removed, please contact us. We may agree to remove usage limit controls placed by us on a case-by-case basis where you have legitimate reasons to exceed these limits and we agree in our sole discretion that it is reasonable to do so.

Breach of this Fair Use Policy

If you are in breach of this Fair Use Policy, we may take remedial action. We may also take remedial action if we are required to do so by applicable law, a regulator or court order. Where reasonable and not prevented by law, we will notify you that you are in breach of this Fair Use Policy, using the contact details we have registered for your account.

If we, in our sole discretion, deem your usage to be a minor breach of this Fair Use Policy, we may first request that you modify your use of the Service in a manner that brings it in compliance with this Fair Use Policy, before we take any other action.

If we deem your usage to be a material breach of this Fair Use Policy, to have serious consequences to others, or to remain uncorrected within a reasonable period after we have notified you of the breach, we may immediately (with or without notice to you), without any liability to us:

\\* give you a warning that further repetition of the breaching activities may result in suspension or termination of the Service;

\\* suspend or limit all or any part of the Service;

\\* terminate your Agreement with us for the Service without offering you a pro-rata refund of any fees paid in advance by you;

\\* exercise any other rights or remedies we have under the Terms;

\\* implement technical mechanisms to prevent behaviour which breaches this Fair Use Policy;

\\* report any conduct or activities to applicable law enforcement or regulatory agencies; and/or

\\* take any other action we deem necessary, including action against offenders to recover costs and expenses.

\*\*Contact Us\*\*

For further information about our Fair Use Policy or practices, or to communicate with us, please contact us using the details set out below:

This growth was driven by enterprise and developer adoption, as well as personal use. Additionally, OpenAI's user base in India tripled over the past year, making it the company's second-largest market. Financially, OpenAI projected revenues of $3.7 billion for 2024, with expectations to increase to over $12.5 billion by 2025, driven by the adoption of AI agents. However, the company faced financial challenges, projecting losses of $5 billion against its revenue, primarily due to high operational costs associated with its ChatGPT Pro subscription plan, which was losing money despite generating significant revenue. OpenAI also secured a $6.6 billion funding round at a valuation of $157 billion, which was the largest venture capital deal in history, aimed at advancing its AI research and development efforts.

Growth Insight

Firefly Aerospace acquired Spaceflight Inc. in June 2023 to enhance its space transportation services and on-orbit capabilities. The company filed for bankruptcy in 2017 but was revived by the investment of over $200 million, leading to its emergence from bankruptcy and achieving a historic Moon landing. Firefly Aerospace raised $175 million in a late-stage funding round in November 2024, valuing the company at over $2 billion. NASA awarded Firefly Aerospace $101 million for a mission and an additional $44 million for experiments, along with a $179 million contract to deliver six experiments to the lunar surface as part of the CLPS initiative. The company also received an $8.2 million grant from the Texas Space Commission to expand manufacturing capabilities and add 50 jobs. Firefly Aerospace's Blue Ghost lunar lander successfully landed on the Moon, marking a significant milestone in commercial lunar exploration and achieving all mission objectives, including operating 10 NASA payloads on the lunar surface.

Coinbase](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/coinbase)

Growth Insight

Coinbase reported a 130% increase in revenue for its 2024 fourth quarter, exceeding analysts' expectations. Transaction revenue more than doubled from the previous year, indicating strong growth despite market challenges. Additionally, Coinbase's non-trading revenue grew 71% year-over-year in Q4 2024, highlighting successful diversification of revenue streams. The company also saw a surge in trading volumes, reaching the highest levels in two years during Q4 2024, driven by institutional trading and the pro-crypto stance of the U.S. government. Furthermore, Coinbase's transaction revenue reached $5.75 billion over the past 12 months, surpassing Nasdaq's $4.54 billion, underscoring its growth in the crypto exchange market. Coinbase Advanced trading volumes increased by 191% in 2024, with derivatives trading volumes soaring 10,950%. The company maintained a 66% market share in the U.S. crypto exchange market, despite rising competition.

## Frequently Asked Questions

## FAQ

#### What's the difference between Crunchbase Pro and the free version of Crunchbase?

Crunchbase Pro helps you make smarter decisions, faster. With premium search tools, growth insights, funding data and more, you can find and prioritize the right opportunities. The free version of Crunchbase helps you learn more about the companies you care about at no cost.

#### What's the difference between Crunchbase Pro and Crunchbase Business?

Crunchbase Pro is ideal for individuals who want to discover companies that matter and make decisions quickly. Crunchbase Business is ideal for teams that need to make strategic decisions and understand companies at scale. Crunchbase Business customers have access to proprietary Predictions & Insights, our AI agent Crunchbase Scout, collaboration tools, scalable integrations, data exports, and dedicated Customer Success Managers.

#### How do I access Crunchbase's API?

Crunchbase Basic API is available to all Crunchbase users through your integration settings. Other APIs can be purchased through our sales team: Crunchbase Data Enrichment provides full and unlimited API connection for internal tools and Crunchbase Data Licensing provides API access for building custom applications and products.

#### What are the export limits?

Crunchbase Pro users can see full search results, but cannot export these search results. Crunchbase Business users can access 5K rows of exports per month. For more exports, reach out to our team about the API.

#### Is Crunchbase SOC 2 compliant?

Crunchbase is SOC 2 Type II compliant. Third-party auditors enforce this rigorous standard to ensure your data is protected within Crunchbase. Learn more about our privacy policies and compliance certifications [here](https://support.crunchbase.com/hc/en-us/articles/19803759211795 "here").

#### How will I be billed for Crunchbase Pro?

We currently offer annual and monthly subscription options for Crunchbase Pro. Annual subscriptions are paid upfront in full, and monthly subscriptions are paid on a monthly basis.

#### What are my payment options for Crunchbase Pro?

At this time, we accept credit card payments, PayPal, Google Pay, and Apple Pay through our website. While we don't offer a way to pay by invoice, we do provide a receipt after the purchase has been made.

#### Does the Crunchbase Pro subscription auto-renew?

Yes, both annual and monthly subscriptions will auto-renew after each billing cycle.

#### What is included with Crunchbase Pro?

Crunchbase Pro is software built on top of Crunchbase's best-in-class private company data that's designed to help users find and prioritize the right opportunities faster. With Crunchbase Pro you can access premium search, growth insights, live market trends, workflow tools, and alerts.

E2open is a supply chain software platform that transforms the way they make, move, and sell goods and services. Their software combines networks, data, and applications to provide a deeply embedded, mission-critical platform that allows customers to optimize the supply chain across channel shaping, business planning, logistics, global trade,

manufacturing, and supply.

| E2net Open Partner Network | A network connecting manufacturing, logistics, and distribution partners for enhanced supply chain productivity and collaboration. |
| Transportation Management | A service for improving overall operations efficiency, reducing costs, and minimizing carbon footprint across all transportation modes. |
| Logistics Visibility | Provides real-time location visibility for goods in transit across all shipment modes, legs, and regions. |
| Due Diligence Screening | A compliance tool for screening transactions against global denied party lists to maintain operational compliance. |

Anthropic is an AI research company focused on the safety of AI systems. Its research includes natural language processing, human feedback, scaling laws, reinforcement learning, code generation, and interpretability. The initial product is Claude, an AI assistant for various tasks. The company develops AI systems that prioritize safety,

transparency, and alignment with human values.

## Products and Services

Powered by AI

Edit Products and Services Section

| Product Name | Product Description |
| --- | --- |
| ID+ Platform | A digital identity verification platform that uses AI and ML to analyze identity elements for fraud detection and identity verification in real-time. |
| KYC | Utilizes extensive identity data for customer growth and compliance, achieving high auto-approval rates. |
| Synthetic ID Fraud | Identifies synthetic identity risks using proprietary models and automated ML pipelines. |
| Document & Selfie Verification | Verifies ID and selfie authenticity for onboarding or authentication, reducing fraud risk. |
| Watchlist Screening & Monitoring | Automates real-time alerts for sanction and enforcement status changes to meet regulatory requirements. |
| Age Verification | Verifies consumer age to restrict access to age-inappropriate digital content or products. |
